programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Namajunas vs. Cortez - Prelims
programme.desc: Luana Santos vs. Mariya Agapova, flyweight; Montel Jackson vs. Da'Mon Blackshear, bantamweight; Jasmine Jasudavicius vs. Fatima Kline, flyweight; Joshua Van vs. Charles Johnson, flyweight. From Ball Arena in Denver.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Namajunas vs. Cortez
programme.desc: Gabriel Bonfim vs. Ange Loosa, welterweight; Drew Dober vs. Jean Silva, lightweight; Santiago Ponzinibbio vs. Muslim Salikhov, welterweight; Rose Namajunas vs. Tracy Cortez, women's flyweight. From Ball Arena in Denver.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: The 2024 ESPYS
programme.desc: Celebrating humanitarian efforts and the year in sports; Serena Williams hosts.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Breakfast at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Breakfast at Wimbledon gets the viewer ready for that day's action with previews, discussion and behind-the-scenes features at the All England Club.

programme.title: 2024 Wimbledon Championships
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz hopes to defend his title when he takes on Novak Djokovic for the Wimbledon crown. Alcaraz defeated Djokovic in a thrilling five-set match in last year's championship. Djokovic is making his 10th Wimbledon final appearance.

programme.title: 2024 Wimbledon Championships
programme.desc: From the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in Wimbledon, England.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: A detailed look at head coach Dawn Staley and the South Carolina women's basketball program as they pursued both an SEC and a national championship during the 2022-23 season.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Minnesota faithful get their first look at Caitlin Clark in a Fever uniform when the Lynx host. Iowa was 7-0 against Minnesota while Clark was with the Hawkeyes. The Lynx boast a 10-2 home record, with Kayla McBride averaging 15 points per game.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: 2024 MLB Draft
programme.desc: Coverage of the MLB Draft from Fort Worth, Texas.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NBA Today

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NBA Summer League Basketball
programme.desc: From Cox Pavilion in Las Vegas, Nev.

programme.title: 2024 Copa America
programme.desc: Third-place play-off.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: The Timbers try to keep up their run against Real Salt Lake. Since 2018, Portland is 9-3-3 in MLS play versus RSL. Felipe Mora, who scored in PTFC's win over RSL in 2023, has tallied seven times across his past eight appearances at Providence Park.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Orioles and Yankees continue their series. The clubs are sending a combined seven players to the All-Star Game, with Adley Rutschman, Gunnar Henderson, Jordan Westburg and Corbin Burnes (BAL) joining Aaron Judge, Juan Soto and Clay Holmes (NYY).

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: From PETCO Park in San Diego.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and France go head-to-head in a battle for a place in the EURO 2024 final in Berlin. It is a repeat of the 1984 European Championships final, when Les Bleus beat La Roja 2-0 in Paris, courtesy of goals by Michel Platini and Bruno Bellone.

programme.title: 2024 Copa America
programme.desc: Third-place play-off.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Netherlands and England face each other in Dortmund for a place in the final of EURO 2024. The teams met twice before at the EUROs; a 3-1 win for 'Oranje' in Germany in 1988 (hat-trick Marco van Basten), and a 4-1 win for England at Wembley in 1996.

programme.title: American Flat Track
programme.desc: Motorcycle action from the American Flat Track racing series.

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: Live horse racing from Saratoga Race Course in Saratoga Springs, New York.

programme.desc: From the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in New York City.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain and England face each other in the final of EURO 2024 in Berlin. The Three Lions won both previous encounters with Spain at the EUROs, including a win on penalties in the EURO 1996 quarter-finals at Wembley Stadium (0-0, 4-2 win on penalties).

programme.desc: A Lionel Messi-led Argentina squad takes on Colombia in the Final of Copa America 2024. From Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Fla.

programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz hopes to defend his title when he takes on Novak Djokovic for the Wimbledon crown. Alcaraz defeated Djokovic in a thrilling five-set match in last year's championship. Djokovic is making his 10th Wimbledon final appearance.
